About me

I am a recent graduate in Computer Engineering from the City College of New York, equipped with a diverse skill set including frontend and backend developemnt for mobile and web applications, game developemnt, HDL programming, and various other skills. With a background in collaborative group projects as well as individual assignments, I am enthusiastic about programming and eager to apply my skills while continually expanding my knowledge. I am actively seeking opportunities to contribute and further develop my expertise. Below you can find some of the various projects I have completed.

View Resume

Projects

NYC Transit app

The NYC Transit App is a user-friendly mobile application designed to streamline and enhance the commuting experience within the MTA service areas. With real-time information and features tailored for New York City's public transportation system, the app provides a comprehensive tool for users to navigate the city efficiently. This app was created using Flutter/Dart as the frontend and Flask python as the backend.

Source Code

E-commerce Computer Parts Project

The goal of this class project was to use software engineering practices to make a E-commerce platfrom for computer builds and parts that caters to different types of users. We were given project specifications which served as a guideline for what the website needed to have. We created two software requirements specification documents which showcases how we used UML models to plan different components of our website, from use cases to data base and enitity relationships. In the Github repository you can take a look at the various documention created for this project.

Source Code

RPS app

The RPS app is a mobile version of the Rock Paper Scissors game. The goal of this assignment was to create an Android app in a two man team. My group used java and the android studio framework to develop our app. We used github to manage and combine our work and used IntelliJ IDEA as our IDE.

Source Code

X86 Emulator

This program is a X86 8/16-bit emulator written in C++.x86 is a family of complex instruction set computer (CISC) instruction set architectures initially developed by Intel based on the Intel 8086 microprocessor and its 8088 variant. The program takes an x86 assembly code file compiled to machine code (.com) and executes the commands.

Source Code
